name: 2021.02: Jason Bahl of WPGraphQL's role in the operating system for the web
2021.02: Torque News Drop: Jason Bahl and WPGraphQL
2021.02: Gatsby Launches New WordPress Integration, Expanding Support for Headless Architecture
2020.07: My Long Journey to a Decoupled WordPress Gatsby Site
2019.06: Modern Web Development on the JAMstack
description: A report from Netlify about Modern Web Development on the JAMStack, published by O'REILLY.

name: WPGraphQL
description: Documentation - WPGraphQL brings the power of GraphQL to your WordPress site.

name: WPGatsby
description: This plugin configures your WordPress site to be an optimized source for Gatsby.

name: WPGraphQL Cors
description: This FREE plugin from @kidunot89 and @byfunkhaus claims to enable authentication with WPGraphQL to “just work” by allowing you to set CORS headers that GraphQL will accept, which means WordPress default auth cookies can be accepted.

name: Total Counts for WPGraphQL
description: This FREE plugin from @builtbycactus exposes total counts to connections in the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL Gutenberg
description: Exposes Gutenberg blocks to the WPGraphQL API.

name: WPGraphQL JWT Authentication
description: Extends the WPGraphQL plugin to provide authentication using JWT (JSON Web Tokens).

name: WPGraphQL Lock
description: Enables query locking for WPGraphQL by implementing persisted GraphQL queries.

name: WPGraphQL Meta
description: This FREE plugin from @robertorourke exposes meta registered via the WordPress register_meta API to WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL Meta Query
description: Adds Meta_Query support to the WPGraphQL Plugin for postObject query args.

name: WPGraphQL Persisted Queries
description: This FREE plugin from @qz adds the ability to use Persisted Queries with WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL Offset Pagination
description: This FREE plugin from @enshrined adds basic offset pagination as opposed to the standard Cursor based pagination that ships with WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL Send Email
description: This FREE plugin from @Ash_Hitchcock allows you to send emails via a simple mutation. Includes the abilitty to restrict sending to trusted origins.

name: QL Search
description: An extension that integrates SearchWP into WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL Content Blocks
description: This FREE plugin from the folks at QZ.com exposes a way to query HTML content from WordPress Posts and Pages as “Blocks” (not related to Gutenberg) to bring more structure to your queried content.

name: WPGraphQL Enable All Post Types (DalkMania)
description: This FREE plugin from @DalkMania automatically adds ALL registered post types to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL Enable All Post Types (TylerBarnes)
description: This FREE plugin from @tylbar automatically adds ALL registered post types to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL Google Schema
description: This FREE plugin from @izzygld261 adds Google Schema support to WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL Gutenberg ACF
description: Exposes ACF blocks through GraphQL

name: WPGraphQL MB (MetaBox)
description: This FREE plugin from @DalkMania adds all registered metaboxes using metabox.io to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL MetaBox Relationships
description: This FREE plugin from @hsimah adds support for the metabox.io Relationships field to WPGraphQL (when also using his wp-graphql-metabox plugin).

name: WPGraphQL Polls
description: This FREE plugin from @andrenosouza allows you to interact with data from the WP-Polls plugin via GraphQL Queries and Mutations.

name: WPGraphQL Polylang Extension
description: Extends WPGraphQL schema with language data from the Polylang plugin.

name: WPGraphQL Tax Query
description: Adds Tax_Query support to the WPGraphQL Plugin for postObject query args (WP_Query).

name: WPGraphQL WPML
description: This FREE plugin from @rburgst extends the WPGraphQL schema with language data from the WPML plugin. In addition it turns off WPML default filters in order to be able to iterate over all posts regardless of language.

name: WPGraphQL for Advanced Custom Fields
description: Exposes Advanced Custom Fields to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL for BuddyPress
description: This FREE plugin from @RenatoNascAlves exposes BuddyPress data to WPGraphQL.

name: WPGraphQL for Carbon Fields
description: This FREE plugin from @matepaiva exposes fields registered using Carbon Fields to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL for Custom Post Type UI
description: This FREE plugin adds settings to Custom Post Type UI allowing you to set which Post Types and Taxonomies registered by CPTUI should display in the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL for FacetWP
description: This FREE plugin from @hsimah exposes filters on WPGraphQL queries to allow for faceted search with FacetWP.

name: WPGraphQL for Gravity Forms
description: This FREE plugin from @KellenMace of @harness_up exposes @gravityforms data to WPGraphQL, allowing you to query for forms, fields, entries, and more.

name: WPGraphQL for Metabox
description: This FREE plugin from @hsimah exposes fields registered using the popular http://MetaBox.io to the WPGraphQL Schema.

name: WPGraphQL for Ninja Forms
description: This free plugin exposes forms created by the Ninja Forms plugin to the WPGraphQL Schema and allows for the forms to be submitted via GraphQL Mutations.

name: WPGraphQL for Posts 2 Posts
description: This FREE plugin from @KellenMace of @harness_up automatically creates GraphQL connections for all of your Posts 2 Posts connections.

name: WPGraphQL for SEOPress
description: This FREE plugin from @moon_meister exposes data managed by SEOPress to the WPGraphQL Schema, allowing for SEO data to be used in your headless applications.

name: WPGraphQL for WooCommerce
description: This FREE plugin exposes WooCommerce data to WPGraphQL allowing you to interact with your store’s data via GraphQL Queries and mutations.

name: WPGraphQl Yoast SEO Plugin
description: Exposes Yoast SEO data to the WPGraphQL Plugin.

name: Advanced Custom Fields
description: ACF PRO

name: Headless Mode
description: Headless mode sets up a redirect for all users trying to access the site. The only requests that are granted admission are ones that are either trying to access the REST API, the WP GraphQL API, or any logged-in user looking to access the headless install to edit or create posts.

name: WP JAMstack Deployments
description: WordPress plugin for JAMstack deployments on Netlify (and other platforms).

name: 2019.11: Guide to Gatsby WordPress Starter Advanced with Previews, i18n and more
description: A tutorial series starting with the basic setup of WordPress and Gatsby with WPGraphQL and then dives into more advanced subjects like deployments, previews, i18n and a page-builder like setup with ACF flexible cotent fields.

name: 2019.08: Live Previews with WordPress and Gatsby
description: Tutorial showing how to use the theme’s higher order component to facilitate previews for WordPress posts and custom post types.

name: 2019.08: Gatsby with WPGraphQL, ACF and Gatbsy-Image
description: A guide, that shows how to implement gatsby-image, so it can be used for WordPress media files.

name: 2018.08: Headless WordPress + Gatsby + Netlify continuous deployment
description: Guide showing how to create a WordPress + Gatsby + Netlify setup in a few simple steps.

name: 2019.11: 25+ Videos
description: Gatsby + WordPress (2019) Complete Course - The series focuses on how we can use WordPress as a headless CMS with a GraphQL schema to interface with. After setting up our WordPress site and theme, we'll move onto Gatsby and how we can use our new schema to generate content for our Gatsby site, programmatically generating pages, converting Gutenberg blocks to React components and finishing off the chapter with a focus on SEO in Gatsby.

name: 2019.07: Gatsby + WordPress with WPGraphQL (with Jason Bahl) — Learn With Jason
description: In this stream, Jason Bahl teaches how to use WordPress with Advanced Custom Fields and WPGraphQL to create an powerful, flexible admin dashboard, then query and display that data in a Gatsby site.

name: 2019.07: Crash Course: Headless WordPress with WPGraphQL, ACF, and React
description: In this video, Alex Young (WPCasts) goes over how to get a simple headless WordPress setup with WPGraphQL and React.

name: 2019.06: Using WordPress with WPGraphQL
description: In this video you will learn how to use GraphQL with WordPress using an awesome plugin named WPGraphQL and some extra cool stuff like GraphQL + Advanced Custom Fields.

name: 2019.04: WPGraphQL for ACF
description: Jason Bahl shows how to use WPGraphQL for Advanced Custom Fields.

name: 2018.07: GraphQL with WordPress and Gutenberg
description: Jason Bahl - 2018 JavaScript for WordPress Conference

name: 2021.01: Building a Headless WordPress Site with Gatsby
description: This course is a step-by-step walk through using gatsby-source-wordpress plugin to create a fully functional headless Gatsby WordPress site with posts, pages, categories, tags, post navigation and other features.

name: Gatsby Starter
description: WordPress Twenty Twenty - A port of the WordPress Twenty Twenty theme to Gatsby using the new gatsby-source-wordpress@v4.

name: Gatsby + WPGraphQL Blog Example
description: Demo showing how to use WPGraphQL as the source for Gatsby Sites.

name: Gatsby + Headless WordPress + Netlify Starter
description: A Gatsby + WordPress starter for continuous deployment to Netlify.

name: Gatsby WordPress Starter Advanced
description: An advanced Gatsby + WordPress starter, that is built along a tutorial series and works with ACF flexible content fields to create content blocks/layouts.

name: Gatsby Starter Blog
description: Blog starter with enough features to be production ready out of the box.

name: Twenty Nineteen Gatsby Theme
description: A port of the Twenty Nineteen WordPress Theme over to Gatsby.

name: Gatsby WordPress Publisher Theme
description: The Gatsby Publisher Theme allows you to create a headless (or decoupled) WordPress site. This theme will display all of your pages and posts in a static front-end built on React and Gatsby.
